sentences.english: Bin Laden daughter hides in Saudi embassy in Iran.
sentences.chinese: 拉登女儿摆脱伊朗软禁，躲入沙特大使馆。

sentences.english: President Barack Obama called last week for Megrahi to be put under house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统上个星期呼吁把迈格拉希软禁在家。

sentences.english: He was confined by the emperor, living like a fish in a pond or a bird in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 他被皇帝软禁了起来，过着池鱼笼鸟一样的生活。

sentences.english: Bathory remained under house arrest in walled-up rooms for four years until she passed away.
sentences.chinese: 巴斯利四年里一直被软禁在封闭的房间，直到她去世。

sentences.english: Suu Kyi has spent much of the past 20 years in jail or house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 过去20年苏姬多数时间遭受监禁或软禁。

sentences.english: Washington wants Megrahi held under house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 美方希望软禁麦格拉西。

sentences.english: He is under house arrest, with his family, in Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 他现在在埃及，和家人一起，正处于软禁中。

sentences.english: The US told the Libyans it wants Megrahi to be held under house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 美国告诉利比亚人，希望迈格拉希被软禁。

sentences.english: President Barack Obama called last week for Megrahi to be put under house arrest .
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统上个星期呼吁把迈格拉希软禁在家。

sentences.english: Describes how to re-enable an add-in that has been hard or soft disabled.
sentences.chinese: 描述如何重新启用已硬禁用或软禁用的外接程序。

sentences.english: The party put Zhao under house arrest and set about erasing him from public memory.
sentences.chinese: 党将赵软禁了并且着手将他从公众记忆中消除。

sentences.english: IT was also where Emperor Guangxu of the late Qing dynasty was kept under house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 这是光绪皇帝也在晚清一直被软禁。

sentences.english: He has described the conditions as “high-tech house arrest.”
sentences.chinese: 他将这种情形称之为“高科技软禁”。

sentences.english: We have also called for the release of his wife and supporters from house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 我们还要求解除对他的妻子和支持者的软禁。

definition: to imprison/to place under house arrest
an execution/to put sb to death

to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
in custody/to keep sb in detention
to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
